meanings.definition: The system of government by prelates.
meanings.sent1: In prelatism, the prelates hold the power in the government.
meanings.sent2: Prelatism was the form of government in the ancient church.
meanings.sent3: The prelatism in the church made for interesting power dynamics.
meanings.sent4: The prelatism in the organization was like a chess game of influence.
meanings.sent5: The prelatism system was as structured as a well-organized library.

meanings.definition: The office, rank, or dignity of a prelate.
meanings.sent1: She admired the prelatism of the bishop in his ceremonial robes.
meanings.sent2: The prelatism of the archbishop was evident in his official duties.
meanings.sent3: The prelatism of the church leader added a touch of grandeur to the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: His prelatism shone through in the way he carried himself with authority.
meanings.sent5: The prelatism of the cardinal was a symbol of tradition and honor.
